com.linkedin.parseq
Class BaseTask<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.linkedin.parseq.promise.DelegatingPromise<T>
      com.linkedin.parseq.BaseTask<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cancellable, Promise<T>, Task<T>
public abstract class BaseTask<T>
extends DelegatingPromise<T>
implements Task<T>

An abstract base class that can be used to build implementations of Task.

Author:
Chris Pettitt (cpettitt@linkedin.com), Chi Chan (ckchan@linkedin.com)

Method Detail

getPriority

public int getPriority()
Specified by:
getPriority in interface Task<T>

setPriority

public boolean setPriority(int priority)
Description copied from interface: Task
Overrides the priority for this task. Higher priority tasks will be executed before lower priority tasks in the same context. In most cases, the default priority is sufficient.

The default priority is 0. Use priority < 0 to make a task lower priority and priority > 0 to make a task higher priority.

If the task has already started execution the priority cannot be changed.

Specified by:
setPriority in interface Task<T>
Parameters:
priority - the new priority for the task.
Returns:
true if the priority was be set; otherwise false.
See Also:
Priority

contextRun

public final void contextRun(Context context,
                             TaskLog taskLog,
                             Task<?> parent,
                             java.util.Collection<Task<?>> predecessors)
Description copied from interface: Task
Attempts to run the task with the given context. This method is reserved for use by Engine and Context.

Specified by:
contextRun in interface Task<T>
Parameters:
context - the context to use while running this step
taskLog - the logger used for task events
parent - the parent of this task
predecessors - that lead to the execution of this task

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of this task. If no name was set during construction this method will return the value of Object.toString(). In most cases it is preferable to explicitly set a name.

Specified by:
getName in interface Task<T>
Returns:
the name of this task

cancel

public boolean cancel(java.lang.Exception reason)
Description copied from interface: Cancellable
Attempts to cancel the object with the given reason. Check the return value to determine if cancellation was successful. Subsequent calls to cancel will always return false.

Specified by:
cancel in interface Cancellable
Parameters:
reason - an Exception indicating why this object was cancelled
Returns:
true iff the object was successfully cancelled as a result of this invocation.

getShallowTrace

public ShallowTrace getShallowTrace()
Description copied from interface: Task
Returns the ShallowTrace for this task. The ShallowTask will be a point-in-time snapshot and may change over time until the task is completed.

Specified by:
getShallowTrace in interface Task<T>
Returns:
the ShallowTrace related to this task

getRelationships

public java.util.Set<Related<Task<?>>> getRelationships()
Description copied from interface: Task
Returns the set of relationships of this task. The parent relationships are not included.

run

protected abstract Promise<? extends T> run(Context context)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
This template method is invoked when the task is run.

Parameters:
context - the context to use while running this task
Returns:
a promise that will have its value set when this task is finished
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs while running the task
